summary: Internal FBI email chain from September 2021 discussing the process for exporting and providing victim and attorney communications related to the Epstein/Maxwell case to the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO). The emails focus on identifying FBI Victim Specialists (VS) who assisted victims and compiling all related email correspondence.

persons.name: VSDVictimOutreach
persons.context: FBI Victim Services Division employee who was out sick and planned to complete the export of the Epstein email folder on Thursday.

events.title: Follow-up on Epstein email export request
events.description: FBI Victim Outreach employee touches base, noting the export process must be done on-site and they will be in the office Thursday to complete it.

events.title: Request to export Epstein folder emails
events.description: An email request is made to export the 'Epstein' folder from the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox, zip it, and send it for the USAO, which is requesting all email communication with victims.

events.title: Internal discussion on victim specialist identification
events.description: FBI employees discuss methods to identify which Victim Specialists (VS) assisted which Epstein/Maxwell case victims, including using case numbers, VNS letters, Sentinel, and VS monthly reports.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) requested all FBI email communications with victims and their attorneys related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The FBI stored victim and attorney communications in a dedicated 'Epstein' folder within the VictimServices@fbi.gov mailbox and on a SharePoint page.

The FBI was working to identify which specific Victim Specialists (VS) assisted which victims, as this was not systematically tracked; they planned to use Victim Notification System (VNS) letters and case records.
The email chain includes a confidentiality notice stating the document is internal FBI material and may not be released outside the FBI without prior authorization.
